intro: Leucojum, commonly known as the white squill, is a genus of flowering plants in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its bulbous roots and showy, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in woodland or shady areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Leucojum species are native to Europe and parts of western Asia. Their foliage consists of strap-like leaves that emerge in early spring before the flowers.
